title: PESSAT MARKS
content: HEY , Out Of 180 , how much to score to ensure cs at ec or rr campus, ik pessat dont release marks and i already know the cutoff rank. just asking an estimate for marks...120+ for rr and 100+for ec ?

comments.body: Cfbr

No idea about marks be a every batch gets a different paper and the scores are normalised in a way as well. 
Prepare well, youâ€™ll get in. Rank wise, a rank under 500 will mostly guarantee you a CS seat at RR. 
All the best to you.

Not a lot of people give pessat and it's shift based. Depending on the difficulty of your paper the marks may drop really low or really high. So just prepare well , answer as much as you can , and this year fee has been increased so ig the cutoff will drop. 
Pessat cutoff for rr cse was 1.2k and ec was 3.3k (2nd round)
are you sure its percentile and normalization process like JEE, rather than just marks vs rank like KCET??

Yes,  if you're in doubt , mail them.
It *has* to be a percentile system because pessat has a lot of shifts with different papers. If you're REALLY lucky you might clear the exam with minimal prep.

My friend last year who had a rank of 90k~ cleared pessat and got a branch in EC (I think AIML).
Thanks man, really eased off some of my pressure.
When's your shift man? I have it on 2nd
4th

90k in jee or kcet?

EC didn't have aiml last year i think

Kcet. They told me "my rank in kcet was my question paper barcode number, but I cleared pessat and got a seat in EC campus" 
And now they're telling me not to come to pes even if I clear the exam lmao
praying for that kind of luck tomorrow man, thanks
can you ask why not to join??

Have you not read the posts here lmao , it's kind of a torturous place and all the good profs have left. And academically very competitive. 
Placements tho are good I've heard.
Best of luck!!
thanks bro
Placements are usually good but because of the current job market scene things have been low this year
I'm assuming you're new to this subreddit lmao
Tell that to my dad , forcing me to join PES even if I get msrit or bms :(
Why not BMSCE though?

He tells me PES is a great college and pretty "strict". 
And a bunch of relatives seem to love the place a lot so dad is fixated on PES.
Show him this subreddit lmao
